title: Leverkusen dominates European Competition
text:
Leverkusen destroys European competition on way to an undefeated season


Code
library(tidyverse)


── Attaching core tidyverse packages ──────────────────────── tidyverse 2.0.0 ──
✔ dplyr     1.1.4     ✔ readr     2.1.5
✔ forcats   1.0.0     ✔ stringr   1.5.1
✔ ggplot2   3.5.1     ✔ tibble    3.2.1
✔ lubridate 1.9.3     ✔ tidyr     1.3.1
✔ purrr     1.0.2     
── Conflicts ────────────────────────────────────────── tidyverse_conflicts() ──
✖ dplyr::filter() masks stats::filter()
✖ dplyr::lag()    masks stats::lag()
ℹ Use the conflicted package (<http://conflicted.r-lib.org/>) to force all conflicts to become errors


Code
bundesligagoals <- read_csv("data/xpgoalsbundesliga.csv")


Rows: 18 Columns: 20
── Column specification ────────────────────────────────────────────────────────
Delimiter: ","
chr  (1): Squad
dbl (19): # Pl, 90s, Gls, Sh, SoT, SoT%, Sh/90, SoT/90, G/Sh, G/SoT, Dist, F...

ℹ Use `spec()` to retrieve the full column specification for this data.
ℹ Specify the column types or set `show_col_types = FALSE` to quiet this message.


Code
bundesligagoalswide <- bundesligagoals |> 
  group_by(Squad) |> 
  summarise(
    Totalxg = sum(xG),
    Totalgoals = sum(Gls)
  )
longbundesliga <- bundesligagoalswide |> 
  pivot_longer(
    cols=starts_with("Total"), 
    names_to="Type", 
    values_to="goals")
ggplot() + 
  geom_bar(data=longbundesliga, aes(x=reorder(Squad,goals), weight=goals, fill=Type)) +
  coord_flip() + 
  labs(
    y = "Goals",
    x = "Squad",
    title = "Bayer Leverkusen couldn't be stopped in league play",
    subtitle = "The Lions put ball to foot and outplay expected goals",
    caption="Source: www.FBRef.com | By: Noah Nelson")

title: About
text: This is Noah Nelson’s Sports Blog. He enjoys looking at statistics to do with Soccer, Football, and Basketball. I am looking forward to introducing different graphics and stats to a future audience.
